title: Admissions Counselor - Online Campus Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions:
The three hiring managers were extremely unprofessional. I took into consideration that the interview was over Zoom, so it would be a little more complicated to read body language, etc. All three managers were dressed very casual and two of them were wearing caps. One of the hiring managers looked like she got back from the gym. I assumed it was a very laid back environment based on how they were dressed. 

The first question I was asked was to tell them about myself. In all interview practices and previous interviews I was always told to not get personal and talk about my previous experience on how it is relevant to the job I am applying for. One of the managers was annoyed, slammed his pen on the desk, and cut me off and in a rude tone asked what I liked to do for fun. 

As the interview went on one of the other managers turned off his camera to go answer the front door. Basically it was one hiring manager answering all of my questions and he doubted my skills and said "We are trying to convince older people to come spend $50k-$70k here and walk away with a single piece of paper in 4-5 years." I was also taught not to challenge the interviewer(s). His camera was also facing the side of his face, so when he spoke he wasn't looking at me. The interview was rushed and they showed no interest from the beginning. 

When I asked questions and I asked about the culture of the GCU and their depts. I was applying for, the manager that was rude proceeded to tell me about his management style saying he was blunt, etc. Which was also a red flag for me.

They made me want to quit and I did not even have the job yet. 

Communication was lacking after the interview. It has been two weeks and there has been no email about my receiving or not receiving the job. It's of course safe to assume I did not get it, which makes it easier on my end to save me from sending a rejection email. 

I spoke with a few of my other HR relatives and friends and it is safe to say that the hiring managers at GCU for that Admissions Counselor Dept. Is extremely unprofessional and they need to do some training with their HR people.
Interview Questions: Hi, Tell me about yourself?

title: Account Executive-Online Division Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Albany, NY) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online via Indeed Job link, heard back via email within a few days requesting a time for a phone screening.  Interview was 30 min long with an HR person.  VERY basic interview with questioning focused on my resume, pay with corresponding companies and highlights of my sales accomplishments.  Nothing creative with the questions here.  HR person spent a significant amount of time explaining that training would be in AZ starting on 9-5-17 and continuing for 2 weeks.   Then back to AZ for 4 days in mid-October.  Asked if I had any conflicts with these dates or the travel.  HR explained pay structure which is NOT negotiable.  Interesting, I've never had the experience in an interview where they tell you the pay and to pretty much take it or leave it.  The position was advertised at $65k and that was the "Level 1" pay.  Quota metrics were based on how many new students you get to enroll with the online program, 28 for Level 1.   In a year you are eligible for level 2, 40 students @$70k, year 2 Level 3, 50 students @ $75k.  In the subsequent year you have the option of going to level 4, 60 students @$90k.  
Also discussed was free tuition and some other benefits.  Kind of a weird situation/place.  I have been out of full time work for over 2 years but doing consulting on the side, so I said yes to everything question related to my availability.  
I was asked how many years experience in Higher Education I had, I said more than 25 yrs.  In hindsight I would guess my age scared them off, I was not asked to continue to the next stage.  Odd since my background in HE sales and as a training coach fit nicely into the job responsibilities which included walking prospective students through financial aid and admissions applications.  Sounds like a lot of hand holding.
Interview Questions: If hired will you continue with your consulting business?

title: Professor Interview

Interview Descriptions: Work as an adjunct if you expect to get an interview.  I got the adjunct job by applying to online job postings.  Phone call with HR.  In person with the department leader. The adjunct experience answers most of the questions your boss will have about you as a potential full time employee.  Your students will share their experiences with your boss.   They want intelligent, dynamic, clear and relevant classroom experiences.  Speak English well.  Know your subject of expertise.  Grade fairly and treat students with respect. Interview Questions: Give an example of an effective use of technology in the classroom

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I had an odd experience applying here, overall. I usually send in a "dummy" resume first, something very similar to my job experience but with a spoofed identity to see what they do or don't respond to. It was very nearly immediately rejected - something like a few hours passed before I got a "no thanks" email. 

I looked for things the employer might be biased against to edit out. I dropped my first two jobs, which were in a more manual labor/service environment based on previous experience helping friends doctor their resumes for Grand Canyon and other similar "Sales, but we call it something different" jobs. Bingo! Grand Canyon is biased against people who had labor jobs, Lord knows why, but pretending I never broke a sweat while making money snagged a phone interview right away with identical practical experience. 

This is where it gets pretty weird: I got the regular screening email. It's "can you work this shift, is this pay acceptable, can you commute to our location" stuff. It's designed for very basic answers, and it's pretty much binary. Either you are willing to take the job as it is, or you aren't. I filled out the form in a very basic, unobjectional way. 

One day later they sent me a rejection letter. It was in fact the identical form rejection letter they sent my first "dummy" resume. Something turned them off, I guess? It would be useful to know what for future interviews, so I sent a letter asking what red flag had popped up and disqualified me. I was very politely told to screw off. 

I've been rejected at first application before, plenty of times. I've been rejected less times at the interview stage. I've never had a screening call cancelled for no apparent reason before, though. Just overall very weird.

Anyway, tips! I have a few friends who have interviewed here before, so here goes:

They absolutely prefer you to either have a degree or be working on one. I had a friend get to the interview stage who had to explain his medically necessary year-long hiatus from his degree program, and that was enough to get a "We would rather have someone who is *actively* pursuing a degree, but thanks." rejection. 

Grand Canyon hates people who had jobs they view dumb people to hold. If you want an office job, may moses bless you if you were a police officer or a carpet cleaner at some point. The base assumption made is that those people couldn't have done those jobs and still be capable typists or salespeople. Again, don't ask me why, because it's not my culture, but just edit those references out.

One friend who lived a few miles away was rejected for wanting to commute on a bike. He explained after being told that they needed "reliable transportation"(he lived a mile away and had a $1000 bike) that he also had a car, but preferred to bike for exercise when possible. It apparently soured the interview. He related that it had a very "bikes are for poor people" feel.

TL:DR; Grand Canyon set up and then reneged on a phone interview for reasons they refused to explain and were terse and unhelpful when asked why. Grand Canyon hirers for "desk jobs" will, based on the experience of me and a handful of friends, reject anyone who lists any kind of manual labor or service industry experience. One bicyclist friend was rejected for what appeared to be "bikes are for poor people" bias. Gaps in college education, even if well explained, will net you a rejection - pretend you are current and hope they don't check. Basically don't be poor, and don't have been poor at any time.
Interview Questions: "Can you make this commute?" "Is the listed salary sufficient?" "Can you work this shift?"

title: Student Services Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview with HR, then in-person interview with same HR Rep and then a panel interview with three hiring managers for the department.  The phone interview with HR has you go over your resume almost line by line.  They want a clear understanding of what your role was in each position and what you did.  Once you get the HR in-person interview, that was situational questions.  If you pass that you are immediately asked to schedule the panel interview which will be more situational questions.  If not, the HR rep will just say thank you, and that they will be reaching back out to you shortly.
Interview Questions: Situational and behavioral questions.  Asked things like "describe a time when..."

title: Site Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Pittsburgh, PA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: A hiring manager called me and described the position.  I was asked given the position needs whether I felt confident I could do the work.  Following, I submitted several pieces of documentation (i.e. teaching certification, clearances, transcripts, etc.).  When all was approved, I had online faculty training.  It was mostly open forum discussion questions online.  You must get a passing score to proceed.  Later, I was given a selection of school sites to choose to supervise.  You are able to decline assignments for any reason.  Currently, I have 3 students. The workload is equivalent to the pay.  I receive $550 for observing a student teacher four times a semester.    I can choose when I visit.  Following, I submit my evaluation of the student through an online management system.
Interview Questions: Do you think you can give constructive feedback to teacher candidates?

title: Junior Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University
Interview Descriptions: Received an email to confirm an interview, interviewed about a week later. After the interview I was informed that I will be notified in about two weeks. After three weeks I was offered the job
Interview Questions: How do you use your strengths to overcome your weaknesses?

title: Lopes Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: October 2016, applied online and got called in for an interview the next week. Interview went pretty good. Lots of behavioral questions like "Tell us about a time when you had to deal with a conflict within your team." It took around 15 mins tops. They called me a few days later with an official offer.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time when you had to deal with a conflict within your team.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Grand Canyon University
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with the department chair a couple of weeks after applying to the position. We went over questions that described the position in detail and the program's curriculum.  Interview questions focused on my past experience and why I would be a good fit for the program. The interviewer was nice and allowed me to ask questions throughout the interview rather than waiting until the end.
Interview Questions: What is your ideal work environment?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University
Interview Descriptions: Applied for job and spoke with recruiter.  This was not a difficult process (moderate recruiting process) takes about 2 months including a course to understand university, background check, must wait for all employer feedback before you can move to the next level.  Must pass the course before you can to teach at University
Interview Questions: Why do you want to teach for Grand Canyon

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was straight forward. Sit down with 2-4 team leads that are hiring for their teams. Place is a glorified call center when you get down to it.
Interview Questions: A lot of "What would you do in ___ situation" type questions.

title: Regional Director of Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: Hope that the little window you might have open is the one this time. But, no matter your fit for the position, the Vice President has already chosen his candidate prior to the interview process so describing the interview doesn't really matter. The last two opportunities really didn't even have interviews, a new person was just placed in the job.
Interview Questions: Tell me about what you can contribute or add to the culture of this team.

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, received email back with screening questions and phone interview time, replied to screening questions and scheduled phone interview with HR. Had phone interview, then 1:1 interview with same woman from the phone interview. She then told me I had to come back for a panel interview with the managers. I scheduled and attended the panel interview. Did not receive offer after 3rd interview. The whole process took about 2 weeks
Interview Questions:
"As a business we over promise things that we are not able to follow through on. Tell us a time that you did this"
"Tell us a time a customer didn't know what they wanted"
"Tell us about a time you gained the trust of a customer"

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Tempe, AZ) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a pretty simple process. They called for a phone screening and then scheduled an in-person interview. The in-person interview was about 45 minutes to an hour of STAAR questions.
Interview Questions: Give us a time that you had to help someone over the phone.

title: University Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: This was a very generic interview. Everyone was very nice and they all did a wonderful job of building up Grand Canyon University. It started as a phone call, then an in person with the recruiter, then with the managers and then a call to confirm the offer.
Interview Questions: All generic questions, "tell us about a time that you faced rejection and how you over came it?" They really just want to see how you think and that you are able to hold a conversation.

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and had a phone interview within a week. The following week, I met the Department Head and had an informal interview which lasted about 1.5 hours. IT wasn't like an interview at all. The HoD and I discussed about my past lecturing/tutoring experiences and how similar they were to my prospective classes at GCU. The interview went very well and at the end of the discussion, we finalized on the classes that I would teach.
Interview Questions: Informal discussion about past experiences in lecturing/tutoring

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online to their website.  The university recruiter calls you first.  If you can meet the schedule of the classes, they setup an in-person with the department chair.  The University has a large pool of adjuncts.  It's not enough money to make a full-time job.  Once in the adjunct pool the assignments are given according to scheduling needs.
Interview Questions: Experience. What you know about the content.  Need a Masters degree.

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: Had a one-on-one interview with a manager and he made the recommendation for my employment.  Received the offer call from Human Resources and started training a week after interview.
Interview Questions: How do I relate to students and getting them motivated to start school

title: Online Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Tempe, AZ) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online.  Phone interview first.  Then in-person interview with H.R.  Then in-person interview with 2 managers in the online division.  I accepted the offer, but was the offer was descended due to background check.  Very disappointing, because was very honest about DUI on application, but I didn't write down the place I was convicted.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about a time when you had difficulty with a manager or team member and how you handled it.

All questions were the STAR method...

Background check extensive including credit check.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty straightforward. I applied via Glassdoor and got an interview request email from the supervisor from Grand Canyon University the next week. I was interviewed by the Administrative coordinator and then I was also interviewed by the dean of College of Doctoral Studies for around 30 min at Grand Canyon University.
Interview Questions: What skills you have that will benefit this position?

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by a recruiter on Indeed about the position.  I responded and she sent me the link to the online application and told me to send her an email when I completed it. I was emailed the next day by someone in HR to do a phone interview.  Before concluding the phone interview she invited me for an in person interview the following week.  After my interview with the HR manager I had another interview with 2 team managers.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about a time you had a difficult customer and how did you handle it? 
Tell me about a time you had to learn a complex system. 
Tell me about a time you had a to deal with a customer who wasn't sure what they wanted.

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: I had a brief phone call followed by a 4 on 1 formal interview later that week. I met with a few different managers from different teams. I assume there were multiple positions available.
Interview Questions: They asked basic interview questions (strength& weakness)

title: Regional Business Development Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Albuquerque, NM) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: First did a phone interview with the HR manager in charge of talent recruitment-nation wide. After passing her, i made it to the final interview with 2 levels up in management. HOWEVER, i was asked to present an entire territory management plan, 3 pages worth of leads, and also do a powerpoint presentation and present via Google Hangouts. I spent no less than 40 hours in 2 weeks researching and putting together all of the information for the interview. Was told no one had made it that far in the hiring process in 6 months. I was excited and put so much effort and work. Then, was told, sorry we had a lot of highly qualified individuals, but thanks for the massive amount of research done, and thanks for putting it in a wonderful presentation and good luck! Luckily i had another offer and was able to take the other job, that i had NOT put as much effort into.
Interview Questions: typical what do you know about us? why should we pick you? concentrated on me putting together tons of research for the second interview.

title: Faculty Scheduler Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Managers were very nice and encouraging. They asked questions about my experience with multi-tasking and with difficult customers. Multiple members of the team were in on the interview which was a little intimidating, but it also allowed for me to get a feel for the culture of the team.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you faced difficulty and how did you overcome it?

title: University Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Tempe, AZ) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application and received a call back from someone in HR. Advised me to come in for an interview. Was expecting to meet with someone 1x1 but was met with a panel of 3 different managers.
Interview Questions: Describe an uncomfortable situation, and how did you handle it?

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with HR, then onsite interview with a faculty member and associate or assistant dean where we discussed my teaching experience and philosophies. They explained the job expectations, class size, etc. Seemed like an okay place to work, but the pay was ridiculously low. I would have been losing money to go work for them.

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview

The interview did not have any questions that I would consider to be Gotch-ya questions or designed to trip me up.  Just straightforward questions.

title: Student In Master's Degree Public Health Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Kansas City, MO) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: friendly. I am an online student. I started out with a Grade A. Only to fail the course. I think it was unfair that I did not get the support expected. The instructor was told, that I was falling behind and his response, while positive did not help me with the tutorials, I needed.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Services Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions:
2 phone interviews, 2 face-to-face interviews
The phone interviews were very easy, it was the last face to face interview that was a little more intimidating. Taking the time to research GCU was well worth it, this company is looking for people who are excited about being part of a big GCU family.
Interview Questions: How do you plan on managing your day? (This position is the liaison between students and Financial Aid  -  Constantly working with various departments to things accomplished  - Expert on a wide variety of rules, regulations with Finances and Academics)

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Interview with a person from human resources asking a lot of situational questions. Got called back in for another interview with hiring managers. They asked the same kind of questions. Got an email three days later that I did not get chosen for the position but that they would like me to interview for a different division, same position. I agreed and had another interview with a different set of hiring managers. Interview was the same as previous two interviews - behavioral/situational questions only. At the end of the interview the managers asked each other what dates they were even hiring for and had to ask me. 

After 4 days of not hearing back about my interview I inquired. Another 4 days later I finally got an email back that I was not chosen for the position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you.......

title: Student Services Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very to the point and easy.  Nothing too tough or out of the ordinary.  I ended up getting a job offer 2 hours after I interviewed.  The final interview consisted of myself and 2 managers. though apparently there can sometimes be up to 4.
Interview Questions: How do you prepare for a busy day of work?  What steps do you take specifically, and how well do you adjust to your plan changing on the fly?  Answer both working as an individual and on a team.

title: Admissions Representative - Online Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my resume online and within one day received an email requesting a phone interview.  The HR Rep called at exactly the appointed time and began a series of questions, lasting almost 30 minutes.  The questions weren't difficult, but I certainly would have answered differently had I had the opportunity to think about them.  At the conclusion, I was told my info would be forwarded to a hiring manager.  I was told I would hear from them within three days.  When I didn't, I called the HR Rep back and left a message.  Days later, I received an email from another HR employee advising me that another candidate had been offered the job.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you exceeded a customer's expectations.

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: The process took about a week. I was emailed for a phone interview, then asked to come in for a interview. I received an offer the next day. The questions were behavioral based questions.
Interview Questions: Behavioral based question

title: IT Help Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Emailed a few times got an interview. Received a test of Information technology questions ranging from basic to advanced. Then the interviewers examine your test before your interview. After a short period they call you in for the interview. They ask you many questions about why you want the job. They cover any experience you may have had and how you work with a team. They were very professional but relaxed and very friendly.
Interview Questions: What made you interview for Help Desk.

title: Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Tempe, AZ) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Started with a phone interview with the recruiter. Came to campus for an interview with the hr recruiter then met with managers after. You were asked a variety of situational questions. They wanted the answers in star format. Interviewed by two people.
Interview Questions: What was situation you had to overcome and was what the result? How did it happen.

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Peoria, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: All I can say is joke! I came into this process with awesome qualifications. I went through all the 3 interviews, which included a phone interview, met with the talent agent, and sat in front of 4 managers. I felt I answered each question with precision, but it ended up being a waste of time. This university is looking for robotic minds, who will simply be happy sitting behind a desk, and not taking on people with character.
Interview Questions: general S.T.A.R....

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Process was fairly inane. They responded to my resume, and asked me to respond to their email to set a time for a phone interview.  They called as scheduled.  The interviewer was polite and friendly.  She was thorough in her description and responsibilities of the position and asked several times if I was still interested after she finished her notes. They spent a great deal of time going over my resume, position by position
Interview Questions: Could you handle making 80-100 outbound calls a day to prospective on-line students and still maintain effective communications via email, inbound calls, etc...

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Tempe, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: I received an email to set up a time for a phone interview.  After the phone interview, the next step  was an in office interview.  I first met with the talent specialist who set up the phone interview and she asked me several questions about why I wanted to work for them, etc.  After that I was taken to a conference room and had another interview that was conducted by two managers.  The managers had great personalities which helped to calm some of the nervousness most of us experience with an interview.  They asked me about my work history on my resume.  They also asked several S.T.A.R. Method questions.
Interview Questions: S.T.A.R. Method questions

title: Student Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: Basic questioning, very casual and welcoming environment. I was asked to bring copies of my resume and dress up in appropriate clothing. Some interviews are held in groups, others are one-on-one, it just depends on how many applicants they have and dates of how busy they are.
Interview Questions: What interest you to become a tutor?

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Tempe, AZ) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took five days. I had a phone interview with the recruiter and was scheduled for an in-person interview the following day. Three days later I received an email regarding their decision.
Interview Questions:
Phone Interview Questions:
- How did you hear about this position?
- Why do you want this job?
- What makes you a great fit for this job?
- What would your co-workers say about you? 

In-Person Interview: STAR Method Questions:
- Tell us about a time when you provided exceptional customer service.
- Tell us about a time when you had to deal with a conflict within your team.
- Tell me about a time when you have had to deal with an angry customer.

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Grand Canyon University
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview which was really standard. "tell us about your last employment experience? Why do you want to leave? What were your responsibilities?".  Scheduled face to face the following day asking behavioral questions in front of a panel using the STAR method.  Told I would hear back the following week but it actually took two
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you missed a deadline.

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions:
The recruiter was very friendly. She took me to a room to meet the two military managers that were going to interview us but they were late. It was awkward and after a while the recruiter had to go find them.. twice.. before they came to meet us for our scheduled appointment. When we walked in they seemed quite friendly at first. One of the interviewers was very nice and more open but she kept looking to the other one for what to ask and how to react to my answers. The other one that was in there asked questions did not smile one time and she stared straight ahead at me, almost without blinking. She almost looked angry. It was clearly uncomfortable to myself and to the other manager in the room. At one point she asked me to review my resume and I went over the first job and looked up to see if she had questions or wanted me to continue. She smacked her copy of the resume and said "I said to go over your entire resume!".  The way she said it was rude and it was as if she was talking to someone that was way beneath her. It was more of an interrogation interview from her. If she wasn't staring, she was writing, with very big writing. Not one time was there a level of comfort in the room and it was obvious that she intimidated the other manager in the room as well. It was one of the worst interviews I have had. She is a manager only interviewing, not an officer interrogating a criminal, yet that is what it felt like. There is no way she is going to really know a potential employee if interviewees are facing interviewers such as that. When GCU is doing interviews, they need to find someone that is better suited to doing that and actually getting a potential employee to really share what they have to offer instead of trying to "show them who's boss".
Thank you.
Interview Questions: STAR Method questions

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Tempe, AZ) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: One on One with a team manager - was asked a series of questions to include experience, the pros and cons of the job. How comfortable was I working in a cube environment.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to overcome an objection of someone who needed school but couldn't afford it?

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (New York, NY) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: 2 phone interviews then live interview. more concerned on looks than skills. wasted time waiting to get opportunity. takes a month to complete interview phases then get an email you dont fit
Interview Questions: will you dedicate your time since not a typical 40hr work wk

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: First you are called by HR for a phone interview to be qualified for a face-to-face interview. Then you go in for a face-to-face interview with HR, and they further qualify you to see if you meet manager's basic expectations. Lastly, you are called back in for a final interview with the manager panel to discuss history and further evaluation.
Interview Questions: What was a major customer service problem you've dealt with, and how did you handle/resolve it?

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Extremely warm and casual process. We discussed my interests and what motivates me. The do pull up your resume so be sure you can elaborate. Other than that it was a lot of fun and they are very flexible on time when they can call.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job title?

title: Talent Acquisition Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University
Interview Descriptions: I had 3 in person interviews in one week and had to take time off work to do so.   The interview questions were pretty standard.  All three HR personnel I met with said different things about the duties of the position and the advancement opportunities...BIG red flag.  I understand not being the best candidate for the role but I felt like they wasted my time and then didn't have the courtesy to personally tell me or email me that they were going with another candidate...I just got an automated email that wasn't even tailored to even having an interview.  Overall, I think the HR staff needs to get on the same page.  The last person I interviewed with flat out told me there was no advancement opportunities.  It was the right decision for them to not offer me the position as I would've declined anyway based on the conflicting information during the interview process.  They also need to be a little more conscientious and respectful of a person's time.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time....a lot of behavioral type questions.

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews. Used the STAR interview technique on the phone and then had an in person interview with three other people. Lasted about an hour and got the job the next day. Easy and peaceful process
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you..

title: Doctoral Enrollment Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very standard.  You are interviewed by two team managers. The managers are not trained on how to interview they pretty much just talk to you and go with their gut.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work for GCU?  Name a time you exhibited excellent customer service?
Standard questions.

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Tempe, AZ) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I submitted two online applications for the same position with different posting dates.  I never got a reply or heard from anyone besides an auto-mated email after initially completing each app.  It took a referral to get an email to set up a phone screening.  Even after my referral submitted my info, it took a week or two to get an email.  However, I later found out that they were starting training for new hires about 10 days out from when they contacted me.  Not nearly enough time to give two weeks to current employer and process seemed quite rushed considering I had submitted two applications anywhere from two to four weeks in prior.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving current position? What would your friends say your strengths are? What are you strengths?  Tell us about a time you provided excellent customer service.

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Grand Canyon University
Interview Descriptions: Interviewers were unprepared.  Didn't know how to interview me and took 5 mins during the beginning of the interview to go over the process.  Although I was told there was multiple positions that were available, what they do not tell you is that you are ONLY interviewing for one slot per the supervisors that were assigned to interview you.  So if they do not like you for their slot, you are not hired.
Interview Questions: What was the most complex situation you have had to deal with in your last position.

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University
Interview Descriptions:
The online application was pretty straightforward.  The interview process seemed superficial.  I spoke with a recruiter who asked a series of canned questions.  Having apparently given the appropriate, politically correct answers, I was informed my file would be forwarded for review by someone in the specific college.  I never spoke with that person.  My file was reviewed and I was approved to continue the process.

Next I was informed that I would be required to complete 8 hours of asynchronous training within a specified one week period AND 3 weeks of online orientation - without pay.

The online orientation required me to be present and engaged online at least 4 of 7 days each week.  To complete the necessary tasks this took 1-2 hours per day.

During the last week I received a call that I would be "penciled in" to teach a particular course.  This is the course I was 'hired' to teach.
Interview Questions: There were no unexpected questions.  The interview was very basic and seemed to be verifying information in my CV.

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Long Process - Applied online and then interview with Manager of team you would join and then you need to wait until an opening happens on that team.  You may be hired right away or as long as two or three months depending on budget.
Interview Questions: Meet with Managers of your team

title: C-Store Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Presented my school and pep band schedule and discussed the things I needed to do before I start working as well as where too receive my uniform for my first day of work.
Interview Questions: Will you be able to work even though you have a busy schedule?

title: SSA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: long interview process. first, there was a phone interview with the HR generalist. This was followed by an in person practice interview with the hiring manager right before the actual in person panel interview. This one featured the position manager, department head, regional director and department senior vice president.
Interview Questions: what's you biggest strength?

title: University Development Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Within a few days of completing an application, an HR Representative emailed me requesting me to reply with the best time to contact to conduct a phone screening. I replied immediately with a specific time period on any day of the week. I waited for a confirmation email with a scheduled date and time and never received it until after I followed up the next day. Let me reiterate that I requested a specific time period on any day of the week and the confirmed time I received back was not at all during the the time period I requested but I replied stating that it would be best if we keep the time I requested. 

The day of  and 10 minutes before the scheduled time of the phone screen comes and I received a voicemail (since it was not the schedule time- I wasn't able to answer the phone) stating that the interview need to be rescheduled for 3 hours later.. Ok, 3 hours later actually works better for me... well 3 hrs and 30 minutes later, I finally got the call. Interview lasted about 20 minutes with a series of average behavioral based questions basically inquiring about previous sales experiences and territory management. Interview went well  and I was told that my application would be forwarded to hiring manager and I can expect to receive a call in 1-5 business days. I made sure (since I have been through interview processes it seems a thousand times and know promises are always made with no results) that I repeated and confirmed what I was just told about receiving a call for the second interview within 1-5 business days... 4 days passed and on the 5th day, I heard nothing. So before the 5th day ended I called the HR rep and asked if I should still be expecting a call from the hiring manager. As I introduced myself she said she remembered me and said "yea, you are the one the hiring manager is waiting to hear from. "We are just waiting on your answer since you said you weren't sure about the training schedule."  <<That in itself let me know where this was going.... "Um, no, thats not me.. I'm such and such, the one who you changed the interview time to 3 hours later last week. We haven't spoken since the phone screen, and I still haven't heard from the hiring manager," I replied.  She says, "Oh ok, He still hasn't contacted you at all?!? Oh, ok let me email him and see what is going on, let me put you on a brief hold. HOLD. "Ok, he said he has found the candidate he is looking for. You are encouraged to apply if other positions interest you." I politely said,"ok thank you." In the back of my mind, I'm wondering why it seems so unprofessional to not send a rejection email to the candidate who took the time to start a process with you. Everything happens for a reason, would I really want to work for a company that is unorganized and unprofessional?
Interview Questions: Although salary is predetermined and outlined in the job posting and at the beginning of the phone screen, I was still asked about my salary for each one of my previous positions.

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University
Interview Descriptions: Had one phone interview and then one panel interview. I was notified during the phone interview that I had been approved for an in-person panel interview. They scheduled it for the next day. I completed the interview the following day, and the morning after that I received a phone call with an offer. There was no drug test, but there was a background check.
Interview Questions: They asked for a lot of specific on the job situations and scenarios. It was easy. They like to see that you're able to multitask, work under pressure, complete quality and accurate work, and still be a positive representation of the university to students and leads.

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Tempe, AZ) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions:
The recruiter seemed confused as originally she was considering me for a different position.  She asked me to email her with 3 dates and times I would be available for an interview.  She didn't get back to me for a couple of days and then it was only to tell me that that position had been filled and would I be interested in the enrollment counselor position.  I said yes, and once again she asked me for 3 dates and times I would be available for an interview.  We scheduled a time for the following Monday.

Later that day, she said she would prefer to have me do an in-person interview rather than a phone screen and asked me again to set an interview time.  I reminded her of the time we had already set and we decided to use that time.  I showed up on Monday and she asked me questions that were basically a phone-screen interview rather than a formal interview.  She mentioned that I would be hearing from them the next day to schedule an interview with the hiring manager.

She also mentioned salary very early in the conversation.  She wanted to know my salary history and was concerned that I might not be happy with the salary they were offering, which was not negotiable.

I never did hear back to schedule the next interview, and follow up messages have not been returned.
Interview Questions: No difficult questions whatsoever.

title: University Development Representative Interview

Interview Descriptions: Totally unprofessional in person interview!  Expected to be interviewed at 7:30pm at night almost 2 hours away from my home.  Then actual interview was near a bar in a hotel and didn't actually begin until 8:30pm!!!  I spent hours creating a powerpoint presentation and when I got to interview, she didn't even have me present it!

title: Student Service Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Tempe, AZ)
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my application, I was contacted approximately 30 days later. After a phone interview, I was rushed into an interview that went well. After the interview, the interviewing hiring manager contacted my internal referral and asked about me and I was told they had a nice conversation. I've been in many interviews and so I know good ones and bad ones and this was a good one. Sent follow-up thank you notes as well.  Was told I would hear back within a week, but I never heard back. After two weeks I contacted the HR coordinator I had been working with by phone and email. After multiple attempts to make contact I never heard back and never received a rejection notice.  My voice mails and emails were flat out ignored. I had also contacted the hiring manager to follow-up after about a month and I never received any communication back from her either.  While I have a feeling I slipped between the cracks, I've never been through an interview process where I never heard back. I've never had ignored communication either. It was extremely disappointing because I have lots of experience and was excited about working for them. It was extremely unprofessional and frustrating because they told me I needed to interview within two days of contacting me, which forced me to change travel plans.  Hindsight being what it is, I don't understand the rush. I can't help but hold GCU in much lower regards because they did not show any respect for me or my time.
Interview Questions: Very average situation questions.

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Las Vegas, NV)
Interview Descriptions:
2 phone interviews about 5 months after I applied.  They then scheduled a face to face in a hotel room with 3! people.  One middle aged man, one very young hip sales person type, and one very foreign Eastern European man who was very sick or something since he was snorting the entire interview.  

Interview started normally, then the young sales hipster asked me if I like sports.  Yes.  What sport is your favorite?  Football.  Do you play fantasy football?  Yes.  Well, pretend like us 3 have never heard about fantasy football at all.....Sell us on it.  SIGH.  Yup, that was the first question.  Once my answer was done, the very European West Coast manager asked me in VERY broken English  "Why do they call it Football when you don't use foot?"  That was, no kidding, the ONLY thing he said to me the entire interview.  

They then asked how I would sell the "Christian" aspects of this school to non-Christians.  How I would talk to family members.  Do I believe more in being a servant or customer service. How I would get past the objections from high school administrators trying to stop me from being a solicitor on their campus.  

This IS a sales position.  Hipster stammered horribly when I asked him what the quota "number" was for students I needed to enroll.  "Well, um, well, we, uh, take, uh information from the region and see what the team should be able to obtain then we, um, take that information and uh, well, come up with your goal.  I also asked how often you have a start?  Middle aged man stammered a bit on that too.  "Our most important time is August.  But we have a start here, there, all the time.  And you have to be prepared to ride a bus with students into Phoenix and set them up in their dorms and hold their hands."  Uh...ok.  

I asked how many people they were hiring. 1!  ONE!  Three men, put up in a hotel, to hire one person, for a sales position with a SUPER HIGH turnover rate?  Ok then.
Interview Questions: The fantasy football sales pitch was wacky and the servant or customer service was one of those trick, no right answer type questions.

Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to make a decision or recommendation that could've put your organization at risk.

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my application online directly through GCU's career website I was setup with a Phone interview with HR. After the phone interview I had a face to face panel interview with 2 managers. I was informed by the manager that walked me out of the building after the interview that I had the job and would hear back from us soon. 24 hrs later I had the official job offer.
Interview Questions: They were your common questions. I would recommend having questions for them, at the end they will ask if you have any questions. By having questions about the position or company it shows them you have a true interest in the company and have done some research.

title: Level I Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions:
Interview took no more than 5 minutes, as a student they will help you get a job on campus.
They had a career fair on campus for students to come explore the options they have to help with their career options.
Interview Questions: Rate you experience with Microsoft office

title: Academic Counselor/Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Tempe, AZ) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: I applied for two different positions online. I first had a phone interview for the EC position and was asked to come in for a 1:1 in-person interview. It was the standard interview questions like strengths/weaknesses and describing situations in previous positions that would help at this job. I didn't hear back from them and tried emailing a couple times but didn't get a response. Then, I got another call asking to set up another phone interview for the other position I interviewed for. After completing almost the same interview in person for the other position I received two emails saying that I didn't get either position.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you experienced a loss and how you dealt with it.

title: Student Service Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Application is submitted through HR website, and they call you to set up an interview. I had a panel of four managers. They called me a few days later to offer the position and sent me an email with details. The interview was pretty generic, and they seem to like my answers about church involvement and community service.
Interview Questions: They may ask you to explain a scenario where you had a moral dilemma.

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: Online application. Filled out an emailed questionnaire with questions like "Why are your skills a good fit for this job based on the job description?".  Phone Interview.  One on one interview.
Interview Questions: Role playing - you are a personal trainer and your client (interviewer) wants to quit the gym because they are too busy.  Convince the client/interviewer to not quit.

title: Admissions Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Tempe, AZ) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: The process is straight forward you have  a phone interview, then go in for a 1:1
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses/strenghts and why do you think you would be a good fit for the company?

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: It was your standard phone interview. Nothing special.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose this job?

title: Student Life Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ) in Jul 2009
Interview Descriptions: I was called for a phone interview and then invited to fly in for a face-to-face.  When I arrived I met with multiple people thorughout the school & was offered the job at the end of the day.
Interview Questions: If we were to highlight your resume on the megatrons what would they say about you?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: The complete interview process was extended over a 2 week period of time.  The first was an email received by the HR Department which I had to summarize 10 questions then phone and then panel interview.  After that process I was turned down for the position.
Interview Questions: Describe your weakness

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: Was interviewed by HR over the telephone first; then met with some arrogant young man, then had an interview with department head.
Interview Questions: Can't remember any of the questions, but they were pretty standard.

title: Employee Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application and received a call from HR. Then conducted a phone interview that lasted about 30 min. About a week later got a call to schedule interview. Face to face interview was basic questions. The next day I was offered the job.
Interview Questions: They did not really ask any questions out of the ordinary.

title: Enrollment Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Grand Canyon University (Phoenix, AZ) in Mar 2008
Interview Descriptions: Interview process went well. Needed to take a test after having 3 weeks of training. The training did not prepare me for the test. We were told we could take the test a second time if we did not pass (earn an 80% or higher). I got a 79% on the test, and the trainer looked at me like I should have been ashamed of myself. Immediately, he handed me the same test to re-take. I had no additional study time, which surprised me.
Interview Questions: How many referrals can you bring in with you?
